intro: Antirrhinum caroli-paui, commonly known as the Caroli-Paui snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
